column5: I've been looking around Toronto for the best price on the Navionics Gold chip for the Eastern Great Lakes and the Dock Shoppe on Lakeshore East has them for $259  Anybody know a cheaper spot in T.O. ??
I got mine from Trombleys in Orillia - was about $215 - may not be worth the drive - but they also have some good specials on right now also.  Later
Good morning Lew:  Here's another reference that may be worth looking at: http://www.jollyannsales.com/navionics.htm
Thanks BARE & Tomcat, I'll check into those.  Brian, your link won't open, says it's not available
Navionics CF/1G901XL3 CompactFlash Gold XL3 Sized Chart, Available In Stock Now, Call for Quantity Discounts and Fleet Prices... 1-800-826-2907 Ext. 260  $178.00  My Webpage  Did that work Lew
What kind of media does your unit use Lew? Compact Flash or SD card?
Lew, find your best price and get BPS to price match for you. You just need a printout from the other vendor's website.
HELLO  LEW You could try (  SHORTWAVE MARINE ELECTRONICS ) AT  905 278 6541 in MISSISSAUGA    .Lakeshore  and  HWY  10 AREA Good luck. KEITH.
I've been calling around some more today and found a place close to home that sells them for $247 and that's the cheapest by far of any place I've called, so I'm gonna grab it there.  Thanks boyz !!
Lew, while you're there would you please see what he/she knows about Nippissing? Thanks.
Lew I ordered mine from PSI mentioned earlier in the thread. Request US postal delivery NOT UPS or Fedex. I was happy with the deal & service. Ted

Roy I inquired the other day by email and this is the return I got.  Mike,  We will have coverage of Lake Nippising in ON, here is the link to all the coverage of this HotMaps Premium Canada chart for 2007, http://www.navionics.com/PremiumLakeList_07.asp?RegionID=5.  For further assistance please call our customer line at 1-800-848-5896.  Kristina Bacchiocchi  Navionics tel: 508-291-6000 toll free: 800-848-5896 fax: 508-291-6006 www.navionics.com

Lew,  Navionics has released a new card the ' 14XG ' replacing the X9 (eastern Lake ontario etc..)  The new 14xg covers the maritime and the great lakes - those SD cards have huge memories now.  If you find the old eastern lake ontario card, don't pay full price they're discontinued.  BY the way, RadioWorld was selling the 14XG for $239.00 at the Boat Show.

2007 US BPS catalog Navionics Gold area 14 SD/14XG 199.99 free fish n chip for US waters only(fishing aid not for navigation) don`t know if it`s and cheaper given shipping and exchange or what BPS up there offers as a price.
I picked an XL9 from the boat show for $239.  Yes I said XL9.  I am covered all the way out to the east coast....amazing.  my 2 cents  2many
I'm getting the XL9....code 14XG....Great Lakes & Maritimes....probably tomorrow.  Tanks boyz !!
Ok so who had the best price?
